==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.1 Magic Systems/6.1.6 Energymancy (WIP).md
==============================

Energymancy is how Energyweavers move energy. Spells will carry most of the specificity; this section defines only the universal rules your class and those spells rely on.
### Costs, Cap, and Casting
- **Mana Cost:** Energymancy has **Mana Cost 0**.
- **Transfer Cap (Throughput):** Per casting you may move up to **TP = your current Mana**.
- **Action Economy:** Unless a spell says otherwise, Energymancy takes **1 Action**.    
- **Attack/Save Defaults:**
    - **Spell Attack** = INT mod + Proficiency + relevant **Subclass Affinity** (never add Generic).
    - **Save DC** = 10 + INT mod + Proficiency + relevant **Subclass Affinity**.
### Source, Target, Sink (Conservation)
- **Source:** where energy comes from (creature, object, area, phenomenon).
- **Target:** where the primary effect applies (may equal Source for equalization).
- **Sink:** where displaced energy goes (ground, air, metal, coolant, capacitor, living target, you, etc.).
- **Validity.** A casting is **illegal and has no effect** if you cannot name a legal Source and a legal Sink for **all** TP you intend to move.
### Per-Type Baselines (per 1 TP moved)
Baseline magnitude when you use **Basic Transfer** (spells may override):
- **Thermal:** 1d4 fire (adding heat) or 1d4 cold (removing heat).
- **Kinetic:** 1d6 bludgeoning.
- **Chemical:** 1 TP stored or dumped; if dumped as damage then half of the damage will be **Fire** and the other half with be **Force**.
- **Gravitational:** 1d6 force.
- **Sonic:** 1d4 force.
- **Electromagnetic:** 1d6 lightning or 1d6 radiant (light).
- **Vitalic:** +1 Vitality, +1 Health, or +1 Mana.
### Media & Range (the important part)
**At SL 1 in any subclass you must touch both the Source and the Target.**  
As SL increases you gain range via media the energy can travel through. **Metal is easy, air is hard.** Ranges below refer to the **length of the total path** from you to the Source/Target/Sink along a valid medium. ‚ÄúJoints‚Äù are the number of times the medium changes (bar ‚Üí water tank ‚Üí pipe = 2 joints).
##### **Thermal**
- **SL 1:** Touch both ends.
- **SL 2:** Metal only, ‚â§10 ft, 0 joints.
- **SL 3:** Metal/Water, ‚â§30 ft, 1 joint.
- **SL 4:** Metal/Water/Stone, ‚â§60 ft, 2 joints.
- **SL 5:** Metal/Water/Stone/Wood/Earth, ‚â§120 ft, 3 joints.
- _Air is not a valid Thermal medium by default; specific spells may allow it._
##### **Kinetic**
- **SL 1:** Touch both ends.
- **SL 2:** Continuous **rigid** path ‚â§10 ft, 0 joints.
- **SL 3:** Rigid path ‚â§30 ft, 1 joint.
- **SL 4:** Rigid path ‚â§60 ft, 2 joints.
- **SL 5:** Rigid path ‚â§120 ft, 3 joints.
- _Air/Ground is not a valid Kinetic medium by default; specific spells may allow it._
##### **Chemical**
_Note for GMs_: Due to the nature of this SL it is recommended to use the Carrying Capacity rules if you have a player using the Chemical subclass. 
- **Rule.** Chemical energy can be **stored in non-living objects**. Each object has a **TP storage limit**; if you **exceed** that limit during storage, the object **explodes immediately**. 
- **Explosion radius:** `stored TP √ó 0.1 ft` (round up to the nearest foot).
- **Explosion damage:** use the **Per-Type Baselines** for the **energy type stored**. When an object explodes it is destroyed leaving little to nothing behind unless the object is magical or enchanted in which case the energy will be released but the object will not be destroyed. 
- **Intentional release:** Intentionally releasing the energy can be done in one of two ways:
	- Explosive - Instantly explode all the energy stored in an object, follows the same rules as an overload. 
	- Siphon - Siphon some energy out of the object and convert it into something else. 
- **Scaling:** Storage **scales with Chemical SL**, for each level in Chemical SL you may multiply the TP per lb by 2. For example, Stone has a TP per lb of 1.0 so you can store 1 TP for each lb of stone at a Chemical SL of 1. At Chemical SL 2 you can now store 2 TP per 1 lbs of stone and so on. 

| Material              | TP per lb |
| --------------------- | --------: |
| Cloth / Rope          |       0.3 |
| Cloudcap Spores       |       0.3 |
| Leather               |       0.4 |
| Crimsonveil Spore     |       0.4 |
| Gravegill Cluster     |       0.4 |
| Vireleaf              |       0.4 |
| Plastic               |       0.5 |
| Aetherveil Bloom      |       0.5 |
| Noctiluven            |       0.5 |
| Bone                  |       0.6 |
| Harori                |       0.6 |
| Voidsand              |       0.6 |
| Rubber                |       0.7 |
| Fellroot Mantle       |       0.7 |
| Mycoflare Cap         |       0.7 |
| Pula Morris           |       0.7 |
| Oil                   |       0.8 |
| Glass                 |       0.8 |
| Wood                  |       0.8 |
| Ceramic               |       0.9 |
| Dirt / Loose Soil     |       1.0 |
| Stone                 |       1.0 |
| Packed Earth / Clay   |       1.1 |
| Brick / Concrete      |       1.1 |
| Crystal / Quartz      |       1.1 |
| Canyonstar Dust       |       1.1 |
| Water                 |       1.2 |
| Echostone             |       1.2 |
| Sweltrine             |       1.2 |
| Aluminum              |       1.3 |
| Seron                 |       1.3 |
| Graphite / Carbon Rod |       1.4 |
| Pyrotalus             |       1.4 |
| Lightnum              |       1.5 |
| Rumblestone           |       1.5 |
| Copper / Bronze       |       1.6 |
| Silver                |       1.6 |

##### **Gravitational**
- **Requires an anchor point** you can see.
- **Anchor range:** SL 1: touch; SL 2: 10 ft; SL 3: 30 ft; SL 4: 60 ft; SL 5: 120 ft.
- Mass limits are on the subclass (see class page).
##### **Sonic (needs a medium)**
- **SL 1:** Touch both ends through a solid.
- **SL 2:** Air/Water straight line ‚â§10 ft.
- **SL 3:** ‚â§30 ft, 1 bend around an opening.
- **SL 4:** ‚â§60 ft, 2 bends; thin wood attenuates but allows passage.
- **SL 5:** ‚â§120 ft, 3 bends; dense stone/metal significantly attenuate or block unless a spell says otherwise.
##### **Electromagnetic**
- **Electricity:** Use **Path Difficulty (PD)** and SL check: you can conduct only if **SL ‚â• PD**.
    - PD chart: Metal 0, Brine 1, Fresh Water 2, Flesh/Wet Wood 3, Dry Wood 4, Stone 5, Air 6.
    - **Range:** SL 1 touch; SL 2: 10 ft (PD 0); SL 3: 30 ft (PD ‚â§2); SL 4: 60 ft (PD ‚â§4); SL 5: 120 ft (PD ‚â§6).
    - If multiple paths exist, current takes the **lowest PD** path; only spells may override this.
- **Light:** Line of sight only. **Range:** 10/30/60/60/120 ft at SL 1‚Äì5 respectively (mirrors/prisms per spell).
##### **Vitalic (living only)**
- **Range to living Target:** SL 1: touch; SL 2: 5 ft via a living contact chain; SL 3: 15 ft LoS; SL 4: 30 ft LoS; SL 5: 60 ft LoS.
### Multiclassing & Current Mana
- **Current vs Maximum.** Transfer Cap uses **current Mana**. If you spend Mana on other classes‚Äô spells, your Energymancy throughput drops until you recover Mana.
- **Recovery.** Anything that restores Mana raises your Energymancy throughput immediately.

Note: This is a reference section, not a reading assignment. Spellcasters only need to read the spells they can access based on their class and level. Use this section to find options and copy down relevant spell details onto your sheet.

Many spells exist in multiple versions, meaning that while they share the same name, their effects and Mana costs may vary depending on the class that learns them.¬†

When learning a new spell, you may choose to learn a Generic spell instead of a class-specific one. Generic Spells are universally accessible and function the same regardless of which class learns them.

==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.2 Spells (WIP)/Energyweaver (WIP)/Thermal/Heat Lance.md
==============================

- **Affinity:** Thermal
- **Action:** Action
- **Range / Media:** As Thermal media ladder.
- **Source ‚Üí Target ‚Üí Sink:** **Source** = a **hot body** in path (e.g., forge, heated blade, sun-warmed stone, creature). **Target** = 1 creature or object in path. **Sink** = **Target** (you are injecting heat).
- **Effect:** Allocate **X TP** (X ‚â§ Transfer Cap). Make a **Spell Attack** against the Target. **On hit**, deal **X¬∑1d4 Fire**. If the Target is flammable and not protected, it **ignites** at GM discretion; continuing damage (if any) is from the environment, not this spell.
- **Miss:** No damage; no energy moves.
- **Notes:** If you cannot name a legal hot **Source** for all X TP (and you don‚Äôt have Vitalic to convert Mana‚Üíheat this casting), the casting is **illegal** and has no effect (6.1.6 Validity).

==============================

Mana Cost: 50  
Affinity: Chaos  
Range: Self  
Concentration: No  
Effect: Freeze time for all creatures except you for 1 turn. While time is frozen, your attack rolls crit and other creatures fail saves (see entry for exceptions where another Time Stop caster may join).  
Upcast: Extend by 1 turn per x3 Mana.  
Prerequisite: Total Level > 17

==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.2 Spells (WIP)/Wizard Spells/Unravel Magic.md
==============================

Mana Cost: 22  
Affinity: Chaos  
Range: 30ft  
Concentration: No  
Effect: Cancel one active spell or effect (Arcana check DC 18 if the effect is stronger than 22 Mana).  
Upcast: Increase the Arcana check threshold per x3 Mana.

==============================

Mana Cost: 24  
Affinity: Utility  
Range: 60ft (wall up to 30ft long, 10ft high, 1ft thick)  
Concentration: Yes (5 turns)  
Effect: Create an invisible barrier that blocks movement and projectiles and provides total cover. The wall is immune to damage. It can be ended early only by effects that cancel active magic (see Dispel/Unravel).  
Upcast: Extend length by +10ft per x2 Mana.  
Prerequisite: Total Level > 9

Mana Cost: 18  
Affinity: Force  
Range: 90ft (15ft radius zone)  
Concentration: Yes (5 turns)  
Effect: The area becomes difficult terrain for enemies. A creature that enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there takes 2d6 Force damage from spectral blades.  
Upcast: +1d6 Force per x3 Mana or +5ft radius per x3 Mana.

Mana Cost: 16  
Affinity: Air
Range: 60ft line, 5ft wide  
Concentration: No  
Effect: Creatures in the line must make a Dexterity Save (DC 16). Failed save: 5d6 Wind damage; success: half.

FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.2 Spells (WIP)/Wizard Spells/Wither Curse.md
==============================

Mana Cost: 16  
Affinity: Necrotic  
Range: 60ft  
Concentration: Yes (5 turns)  
Effect: One creature must make a Constitution Save (DC 16). On a failed save, it takes 2d6 Necrotic damage at the start of each of its turns, and healing it receives is reduced by 25% for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, it may repeat the save, ending the effect on a success.  
Upcast: +1d6 Necrotic per x3 Mana or increase the heal reduction to 50% per x4 Mana.

==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.4 Runes/6.4.1 Runes.md
==============================

Runes are a form of magic created by inscribing specific symbols into a surface. A rune has a defined function, and multiple runes can be combined to create more complex effects.
### Runic Schools
Runes are divided into three schoolings:
- **Xeran**: Uses **runic circles** with **5 or more runes** to create scalable effects.
- **Serenite**: Uses **exactly 3 runes** (a ‚Äútriangle‚Äù/set of three). It is less flexible, but more efficient and combat-ready.
- **Vindroth**: Uses **written sentence structures** (‚Äúparagraphs‚Äù) to create conditional, programmed rune effects.
### Runemaster Schooling Progression
At **Runemaster level 1**, you must choose **one** schooling: **Xeran**, **Serenite**, or **Vindroth**.
- You **cannot** use runes from a schooling you have not learned.
- You may not learn an additional schooling until you have taken **6 levels** in each schooling you already know.
- Many rune features reference **School Level** (your level in that specific schooling), not your total Runemaster level.
- After you have completed **all three schoolings to 6** (total **18 Runemaster levels**), features that reference ‚Äúlevel requirement‚Äù may instead use your **total Runemaster level**.
#### Runemaster Level Beyond 20 (Multiclass Scaling)
After **Runemaster level 20**, you may increase your effective ‚ÄúRunemaster Level‚Äù for rune castings by adding **half of your levels in other magical classes** (rounded down).  
Example: Runemaster 20 + Wizard 10 counts as **Runemaster 25** for rune castings.
## Crafting Runes
Runes must be **inscribed** into a material before they can be used.
### Requirements
To inscribe a rune, you must have:
- An **Inscription Kit**
- At least **1 level in Runemaster**
- Knowledge of the specific rune being inscribed
- The required time (based on the material)
### Rune Knowledge Limits
- A Runemaster can know **1 rune per Runemaster level** (the Xeran rune Carbon does not count and is free but requires one Xeran Schooling Level).
- You may change which runes you know every **2 Runemaster levels**.
### Crafting Rules
- **Durability**: The number of castings the inscription can withstand before the rune becomes unusable.
- **Modifier**: Applied to rolls made using the rune inscribed on that material (when a roll is required) or added to flat bonuses.
- If you attempt to craft during combat, inscription takes **one full action**.
- If inscription is **interrupted for any reason**, the attempt **fails**.
## Rune Inscription Materials

| Material     | Durability | Modifier | Time to Craft | Other                                                  |
| ------------ | ---------- | -------- | ------------- | ------------------------------------------------------ |
| Wood         | 1          | -3       | 6 seconds     |                                                        |
| Stone        | 2          | -2       | 10 min        |                                                        |
| Echostone    | 5          | -1       | 5 min         |                                                        |
| Iron         | 3          | 0        | 25 min        |                                                        |
| Steel        | 4          | +1       | 35 min        |                                                        |
| Silver       | 5          | +2       | 20 min        |                                                        |
| Copper       | 3          | +3       | 10 min        |                                                        |
| Bronze       | 4          | +4       | 15 min        |                                                        |
| Ferroflux    | 3          | +5       | 5 min         |                                                        |
| Runewood     | 8          | +6       | 12 seconds    |                                                        |
| Canyonstar   | 6          | +7       | 10 min        |                                                        |
| Gold         | 2          | +8       | 36 seconds    |                                                        |
| Phoenixscale | 4          | +9       | 1 hour        |                                                        |
| Platinum     | 6          | +10      | 1 hour        |                                                        |
| Obsidian     | 5          | +11      | 3 hours       |                                                        |
| Moltenheart  | 5          | +12      | 2 hours       |                                                        |
| Voidglass    | 4          | +13      | 8 hours       |                                                        |
| Nerite       | 10         | +14      | 16 hours      |                                                        |
| Skin         | Unlimated* | +3       | 3 hours       | Each casting roll 1d20, on a 1 the runes are destroyed |
| Ice          | 3          | +4       | 18 seconds    | Only Serenite Runes                                    |


==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.4 Runes/6.4.2 Xeran Runes.md
==============================

Xeran runes are primarily used in **runic circles** or **embedded into objects**. Most Xeran runes have little or no effect on their own; the intended use is combining multiple runes into a circle to create a scalable effect.
### Learning Xeran
To cast a Xeran runic circle, you must know:
- **Carbon**, and at least **one** other Xeran rune.
### Xeran Runic Circles
A **Xeran runic circle** is a single circle of runes inscribed into one material. Circles are typically activated by supplying them with **mana**.
**Rules**
- Xeran circles use **5 or more runes**.
- Xeran circles normally cannot exceed **19 total runes** (**10 non-carbon** runes + **9 Carbon** runes).
- Xeran circles can be activated **once per turn** as an action with a range of touch.
	- The range of activation goes up by 5 ft per Schooling Level
- A circle can be activated a number of times equal to the **Durability** of the material before the inscription becomes unusable.
- **Mixing materials** within the same circle causes the circle to **fail**.
### Carbon Requirement
A Xeran circle must include Carbon runes as stabilizers.
- In a circle, the number of **Carbon** runes must equal:  
    **(Number of non-carbon runes) - 1**  
    (Ignore _Link_ runes for this requirement.)
### Mana Cost and Level Requirements
Mana costs increase exponentially as the number of non-carbon runes increases.

|# of non-carbon runes|Circle size (runes)|Mana Requirement|Level Requirement|
|---|---|---|---|
|3|5 (3 regular, 2 Carbon)|5|1 (School Level)|
|4|7 (4 regular, 3 Carbon)|10|2|
|5|9|20|3|
|6|11|40|4|
|7|13|80|6|
|8|15|160|18 (Runemaster Level)|
|9|17|320|19|
|10|19|640|20|
## Xeran Rune Tables
#### Utility Runes
Utility runes are used to control activation, linking, targeting logic, timing, and direction.

| Rune     | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                | Effect (Weapon) | Effect (Armor) |
| -------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------- | -------------- |
| Carbon   | **Required stabilizer.** In a runic circle, the number of Carbon runes must equal the number of other runes (ignoring Links) **minus 1**.                                                                  | None            | +1 AC          |
| Time     | Acts as a timer. You may load the Time rune with mana; every minute it loses 1 stored mana. A Detect rune can be used to trigger when the timer reaches a specific value or runs out.                      | +3 to Hit       | +2 AC          |
| Detect   | Detects a specified thing. Use a Link rune and a rune outside the circle to define what is being detected. Can be used with other circles to detect complex conditions.                                    | None            | None           |
| Kinetic  | Applies motion/force. Must be given a direction; if left without a direction, the energy releases outward in all directions and the circle‚Äôs effectiveness is reduced by half.                             | +2 to Hit       | +1 AC          |
| Creation | Creates a specified element when linked with that element. Can be linked to a circle to produce more complex items. Must be supplied with adequate mana to function (1 mana per gram of material created). | None            | Unbreakable    |
| Link     | Links runes/circles to allow more complex structures and external references. This allows multiple materials to be used in one casting across multiple circles.                                            | None            | None           |
| Up       | Linked activation is directed upward.                                                                                                                                                                      | None            | None           |
| Down     | Linked activation is directed downward.                                                                                                                                                                    | None            | None           |
| North    | Linked activation is directed north.                                                                                                                                                                       | None            | None           |
| East     | Linked activation is directed east.                                                                                                                                                                        | None            | None           |
| South    | Linked activation is directed south.                                                                                                                                                                       | None            | None           |
| West     | Linked activation is directed west.                                                                                                                                                                        | None            | None           |
| Out      | Linked activation applies in all directions outward (excluding things inside the circle).                                                                                                                  | None            | None           |
| In       | Linked activation applies inward, only affecting things inside the circle.                                                                                                                                 | None            | None           |
#### Elemental Runes
Elemental runes provide elemental effects. When mixed in a circle, their damage types combine and their damage stacks. The damage type of the runic circle will be the combined damage type from [[2.6 Damage Types and Resistances]], if no compatible damage type exists multiple damage types may be used for a single casting. 

**Opposites:** Opposite elements cannot be used together without negating each other on a 1-for-1 basis.  
Example: 2 Fire + 1 Water = 1 Fire.

**Infernal Exception:** Infernal runes allow opposites to combine into their combined damage types instead of negating (see Infernal in Special Runes).

|Rune|Description|Effect (Weapon)|Effect (Armor)|
|---|---|---|---|
|Fire|Fire, opposite of Water|+1d6 Fire Damage|Protect from 1d4 Fire damage per attack|
|Earth|Earth, opposite of Air|+1d6 Earth Damage|Protect from 1d4 Earth damage per attack|
|Water|Water, opposite of Fire|+1d6 Water Damage|Protect from 1d4 Water damage per attack|
|Air|Air, opposite of Earth|+1d6 Air Damage|Protect from 1d4 Air damage per attack|
|Necrotic|Dark Magic, opposite of Radiant|+1d6 Necrotic Damage|Protect from 1d4 Necrotic damage per attack|
|Radiant|Holy Magic, opposite of Necrotic|+1d6 Radiant Damage|Protect from 1d4 Radiant damage per attack|
|Psychic|Mental energy, opposite of Force|+1d6 Psychic Damage|Protect from 1d4 Psychic damage per attack|
|Force|Pure magical energy, opposite of Psychic|+1d6 Force Damage|Protect from 1d4 damage per attack|
### Special Runes
Special runes have unique effects and are typically used to alter, bypass, or destroy rune structures.

| Rune       | Description                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    | Effect (Weapon)      | Effect (Armor)                                 |
| ---------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | -------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| Chaos      | Randomizes the circle‚Äôs damage type between the elemental runes. Roll 1d8 and count down the elemental rune table.                                                                                                                                                                                             | +1d12 Random Damage  | If roll is <4 gain +2 AC, otherwise lose -2 AC |
| Void       | Counters rune circles by destroying them while the Void rune remains inside. If the circle contains more than 4 non-carbon runes, additional Void runes are required: **1 Void per additional 4 non-carbon runes**. (This rune is not inscribed into the material of the circle, it is separate and placed on) | +2d8 True Damage     | -1 to all non-magical damage taken             |
| Cursed     | Reverses a spell‚Äôs damage type (example: Water becomes Fire).                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  | +1d8 Cursed Damage   | Resistance to cursed damage                    |
| Infernal   | Allows opposite rune types to be stacked without negation, converting them into their combined damage types. One Infernal rune supports up to **4 other runes** before requiring an additional Infernal rune (**1 per 4**).                                                                                    | +1d8 Infernal Damage | -1 to all magical damage taken                 |
| Corruption | After activation completes, the circle destroys all runes in the circle, leaving nothing remaining.                                                                                                                                                                                                            | +1 Corruption Damage | Immunity to Corrupt condition                  |

==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.4 Runes/6.4.3 Serenite Runes.md
==============================

Serenite runes are designed for **fast, combat-ready rune work**, primarily through **armor inscriptions** and **fixed 3-rune sets**. Serenite does not use Carbon stabilizers.
### Serenite Rune Counts
Serenite inscriptions follow strict size rules:
- You may inscribe and use **exactly 1 rune**, or **exactly 3 runes** as a set.
- You may never use **2 runes**, and you may never use **more than 3**.

A 3-rune set is commonly called a **Serenite triangle** (a fixed group of three runes).
### Activation and Mana Cost
Serenite effects are activated by supplying mana.
- **Mana cost:** **5 mana per rune**
    - **1 rune:** 5 mana
    - **3 runes (triangle):** 15 mana
- **Activation timing:**
    - Activating a **Serenite triangle** requires **one action**.
    - Activating a **single Serenite rune** requires a **bonus action**.
    - Activation is done at a range of 5 ft within sight, each Serenite schooling level that goes up by 5 ft. 
### Serenite School Scaling
A Serenite Runemaster learns runes and gains flat casting bonuses as they advance.
- You learn **1 Serenite rune per Serenite School Level**, up to **School Level 6**.
- At **School Level 6**, you gain **+3 to all Serenite castings**.
- At **Runemaster level 19**, you gain an additional **+3 to all castings**.
- At **Runemaster level 20**, you gain an additional **+3 to all castings**.
## Serenite Rune Effects

| Rune  | Effect (Singular)                                                                                                              | Effect (Weapon)                  | Effect (Armor)                                                                                                                                                                                     |
| ----- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ | -------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Ice   | Explodes (DC 10 Dex Save), dealing **2d4 Ice damage** to all creatures within **10 ft**                                        | +1d8 Ice Damage                  | -1 incoming piercing/slashing damage. If all three runes are Ice in a triangle, gain resistance to piercing/slashing damage                                                                        |
| Water | Heal the creature holding the rune for **1d4 Vitality**                                                                        | +3 Bludgeoning Damage            | +1d4 Vitality per turn. If all three runes are Water gain +5d4 instead.                                                                                                                            |
| Wind  | Gain **+5 ft movement speed**                                                                                                  | +2 to hit                        | +5 ft movement speed. If all three runes are Wind, gain **+1 bonus action**                                                                                                                        |
| Metal | Deal **1d12 Bludgeoning damage** to a target within **15 ft**                                                                  | +1 to hit, +1 Bludgeoning Damage | +3 AC. If all three runes are Metal, gain **+1 to hit on all attacks**                                                                                                                             |
| Mana  | Stores up to **(Durability modifier √ó 10)** mana, or may be activated as a mana bomb to deal Force damage equal to mana stored | +1d4 Force Damage                | Spend mana to reduce incoming damage: each Mana rune can stop **10 damage**. If all three runes are Mana, the max damage reduction increases from **10** to **50** (only one Mana circle per turn) |
## Serenite Special Combinations
Special combinations only apply when you have a **3-rune Serenite triangle** with the listed recipe.

|Recipe|Effect (Weapon)|Effect (Armor)|
|---|---|---|
|Ice + Water + Wind|Ignore resistances|None|
|Metal + Mana + Ice|None|Gain resistance to all non-magical damage|
|Mana + Mana + Water|Target becomes vulnerable to all damage for 1 turn|None|
|Ice + Ice + Wind|Attacks slow the target (movement speed halved) until end of their next turn|Enemies that hit you lose 5 ft movement on their next turn|
|Ice + Water + Water|On hit, target has disadvantage on their next attack roll|Gain advantage on the next healing effect applied to you|
|Wind + Wind + Water|Attacks may push the target up to 10 ft (Strength Save DC 10)|Opportunity attacks against you are made at disadvantage|
|Wind + Wind + Ice|Attacks gain +10 ft reach for this turn|You may move through difficult terrain without penalty|
|Metal + Ice + Wind|Critical hits deal an additional 1d8 Ice damage|None|
|Metal + Metal + Ice|None|Gain immunity to being knocked prone|
|Mana + Water + Wind|On hit, restore mana equal to half the damage dealt (once per turn)|Regain 5 mana at the start of your turn if you move more than 10 ft|
|Ice + Ice + Water|Attacks inflict Frostbitten|Reduce incoming damage by 1d6 if you did not move on the previous turn|


==============================
FILE: Chapter 6 - Magic and Abilities/6.4 Runes/6.4.4 Vindroth Runes.md
==============================

Vindroth runes are written as **sentence structures** (often called _paragraphs_), allowing rune magic to function like a **programmed trigger system**: _when a condition is met, an effect occurs_.

Vindroth runes are not arranged in circles. Instead, they are inscribed as ordered ‚Äúwords‚Äù that form a readable sequence (ex: **If ‚Ä¶ Than ‚Ä¶ Else ‚Ä¶**).
### Inscription Rules
- Each Vindroth rune occupies **1 square inch** of space.
- All runes in a paragraph must be inscribed into **one continuous piece of material**.
- If the material has a complete break that separates words, the paragraph **loses the separated words**. This may weaken, change, or fully disable the effect.
### Vindroth Structure Limits
A Vindroth paragraph is limited by your **Vindroth School Level**.
- You may include **1 ‚ÄúIf ‚Ä¶ Than‚Äù block per Vindroth School Level**.
- Each Vindroth School Level also increases how many logic-connectors you may include (Else / And / Or / Not).
- At **level 19**, the maximum increases from **6 to 7** and at **20** it raises again to 8. From this point every 2 levels of effective Runemaster Level raises the maximum by 1. 
### Rune Knowledge
- If and Than runes are always known and do not count against total runes known. 
### Using Xeran as Effect Payloads
Vindroth can call Xeran runes as **effect payloads** (usually to define damage type / element / output).
Example structure:
- **If** object (human) **entered** size (5) shape (sphere) **Than** Power (Xeran Fire)
To increase output, you may repeat effect runes:
- ‚Ä¶ **Than** Power (Xeran Fire) **And** Power (Xeran Fire)
With each And Power adding another damage as well as consuming 1 Structure Limit
## Vindroth Conditionals

| Rune          | Effect                                                                                                       |
| ------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ |
| If            | Begins a conditional check.                                                                                  |
| Than          | Executes the next statement(s) if the condition is true.                                                     |
| Else          | Executes the next statement(s) if the previous condition was false (may be followed by **If**).              |
| And           | Combines conditions/effects; both must apply (when used with **If**) or both occur (when used with effects). |
| Or            | Combines conditions; either condition being true is sufficient.                                              |
| Not           | Negates a condition (true only if the condition is not met).                                                 |
| at            | Specifies the point of origin / location where the effect occurs.                                            |
| while         | Keeps the effect active as long as the condition remains true.                                               |
| size          | Defines area size; maximum area is **5 √ó Vindroth School Level**.                                            |
| shape         | Defines area shape (sphere, cube, spear (directional attack)).                                               |
| object        | Defines what is being checked or targeted (leave blank to mean ‚Äúany‚Äù).                                       |
| within        | True if the object is within the specified range/area.                                                       |
| entered       | True if the object enters the specified range/area.                                                          |
| value         | Stores a named value (variable).                                                                             |
| equals        | True if two values are equal.                                                                                |
| greater       | True if the first value is greater than the second.                                                          |
| lesser        | True if the first value is less than the second.                                                             |
| has           | True if the object has a specified property/flag/mark.                                                       |
| lacks         | True if the object lacks a specified property/flag/mark.                                                     |
| self          | True if the object is the caster.                                                                            |
| touched       | True if the inscribed surface is touched.                                                                    |
| moved         | True if the object moved.                                                                                    |
| attacked      | True if the object attacked.                                                                                 |
| damaged       | True if the object took damage.                                                                              |
| healed        | True if the object was healed.                                                                               |
| cast          | True if the object casts a spell.                                                                            |
| chance        | Roll 1d10 and return the number (usable with comparisons like greater/lesser/equals).                        |
| direction     | Specifies a direction (up/down/north/south/east/west). You may also use Xeran direction runes for this.      |
| throw (Type)  | Specifies the saving throw type used by an effect.                                                           |
| throw (Value) | Specifies the save DC. The DC cannot exceed **10 + Vindroth School Level**.                                  |
| delay         | Delays an effect in 6-second intervals, max **18 √ó Vindroth School Level**.                                  |
## Vindroth Effects

| Rune            | Effect                                                                                                                                                                                   |
| --------------- | ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| Power           | Deal **1d4 damage** (damage type defined by the attached Xeran element, if any) (counts as a spell attack (unless otherwise specified), roll 1d20 and add Material Modifier for to hit). |
| Heal (Vitality) | Heal **1d4 Vitality**.                                                                                                                                                                   |
| Heal (Health)   | Heal **1d4 Hit Points**.                                                                                                                                                                 |
| Create          | Create a specified **Xeran element**.                                                                                                                                                    |
| Resist          | Grant resistance to a specified damage type.                                                                                                                                             |
| Vulnerable      | Grant vulnerability to a specified damage type.                                                                                                                                          |
| Dispel          | Counterspell all castings in range with mana cost lower than **20 √ó Vindroth School Level**.                                                                                             |
| Add             | Add a specified number to a specified value (number is defined by mana put into the rune during inscription).                                                                            |
| Subtract        | Subtract a specified number from a specified value (number is defined by mana put into the rune during inscription).                                                                     |
| Multiply        | Multiply a specified value by a specified number (number is defined by mana put into the rune during inscription).                                                                       |
| Divide          | Divide a specified value by a specified number (number is defined by mana put into the rune during inscription).                                                                         |
| Mark            | Apply a named mark to a target. The mark is invisible, but can be detected by **has**.                                                                                                   |
| Push            | Move the target in the specified direction (Strength save **10 + Vindroth School Level**).                                                                                               |
| Trap            | Apply the Prone condition (Strength save **10 + Vindroth School Level**).                                                                                                                |
## Example Castings

### Simple Fire Trap (Entry Trigger)
**Structure**
```
If object (any) entered size (5) shape (sphere)
Than Power (Xeran Fire)
```
**What it Does**  
Deals **1d4 Fire damage** to any creature that enters a 5 ft sphere around the inscription.

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 1
- Logic connectors: 0

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **1**

**Notes**  
Baseline Vindroth usage. This is the canonical ‚Äúrune trap‚Äù example.
### Healing Plate (Touch Trigger)
**Structure**
```
If object (self) touched
Than Heal
```
**What it Does**  
When the caster touches the inscribed surface, they heal **1d4 HP**.

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 1
- Logic connectors: 0

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **1**
### Directional Force Push Trap
**Structure**
```
If object (any) entered size (5) shape (sphere)
Than Push direction (north)
```
**What it Does**  
Any creature entering the area must make a Strength save or be pushed north.

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 1
- Logic connectors: 0

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **1**
### Conditional Trap with Else Clause
**Structure**
```
If object (self) entered size (5) shape (sphere)
Than Heal (Vitality)
Else Power (Xeran Necrotic)
```
**What it Does**
- If the caster enters: heal **1d4 Vitality**
- Otherwise: intruders take **1d4 Necrotic damage**

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 1
- Else clauses: 1

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **2**
### Mana-Scaling Kill Zone
**Structure**
```
While object (any) within size (10) shape (sphere)
Than Power (Xeran Fire)
And Power (Xeran Fire)
And Power (Xeran Fire)
```
**What it Does**  
Deals **3d4 Fire damage** to all creatures within the area each turn until they leave area

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 1 (while)
- Logic connectors: 2 (extra Power via And)

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **3**
### Damage with Save and Delay
**Structure**
```
If object (any) entered size (5) shape (sphere)
Than delay (6)
And Power (Xeran Fire)
And throw (Dex)
And throw (10)
```
**What it Does**  
After 6 seconds, deals **1d4 Fire damage** to creatures in the area, Dex save (10) to resist.

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 1
- Logic connectors: 3 (delay, And Power, And throw)

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **4**
### Mark-and-Execute Rune
**Structure**
```
If object (any) entered size (5) shape (sphere)
Than Mark (prey)

If object (any) has (prey)
And attacked
Than Power (Xeran Fire)
And Power (Xeran Fire)
```
**What it Does**
- First trigger: entering marks the target.
- Second trigger: if a marked target attacks, they take **2d4 Fire damage**.

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 2
- Logic connectors: 2

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- **4**
### Smart Defense Engine
**Structure**
```
If object (any) entered size (20) shape (sphere)
And lacks (ally)
Than Mark (hostile)

If object (any) has (hostile)
And cast
Than Dispel

If object (any) has (hostile)
And attacked
Than Power (Xeran Force)
And Power (Xeran Force)
And throw (Str)
And throw (15)

Else Heal
```
**What it Does**
- Marks non-allies entering the area
- Dispels hostile spellcasting
- Punishes hostile attacks with **2d4 Force damage** (Strength save)
- Heals allies when no hostile condition is met

**Structure Use**
- If/Than blocks: 3
- And connectors: 6
- Else: 1

**Minimum Vindroth School Level**
- 10

| **Gold**           |        1.25 |     ‚àí2 |                 ‚àí2 |                   10 | Terrible weapon/armor; **great conduit** for trinkets/jewelry.                        |
| **Platinum**       |        1.15 |      0 |                 ‚àí1 |                   10 | Noble metal; stable rune lattice.                                                     |
| **Obsidian**       |        0.80 |     ‚àí1 | (+1 on 19‚Äì20 only) |                   11 | Razor edge but **brittle**: breaks on nat-1 attack or after 3 crits/session.          |
| **Voidglass**      |        0.30 |      ‚Äî |                  ‚Äî |                **9** | For **vessels/foci**; shatterproof vs. magic; not for weapons/armor.                  |

_Legend:_ S/P = slashing/piercing, B = bludgeoning. Lower **Engraving DC** = easier to embed runes.
## How to Apply (quick rules)

**Weapons**  
Final damage = base die shifted by the material‚Äôs **Weapon Die Step** (min d4).  
‚Ä¢ Add **on-crit riders** from special materials (Echostone, Phoenixscale, Moltenheart, etc.).  
Final weight = base √ó Weight Mult.

**Armor & Shields**  
Final AC = base AC + **AC Mod** (per material).  
Final weight = base √ó Weight Mult.  
Keep your existing **Armor Properties** & penalties.

**Per-material riders (weapons):**  
‚Ä¢ **Phoenixscale:** add **+1 Fire** to every hit; **on crit** target **Ignite 1d6 (2 rounds)** (once/turn).  
‚Ä¢ **Moltenheart:** **on crit**, add **1d4 Fire** and **Cling** (1 round).  
‚Ä¢ **Echostone:** **on crit**, add **1d4 Thunder** (echo).  
‚Ä¢ **Voidsand:** attacks **ignore 1 point of magical AC** (barriers, shield wards).  
‚Ä¢ **Nerite:** **+1 Rune Capacity**; ‚àí1 Initiative when wielded (hefty).  
‚Ä¢ **Silver:** +2 damage vs Undead/Fiends/Shapechangers.  
‚Ä¢ **Obsidian:** **Brittle** (see profile).

### Rarity Reference

|Rarity|Description|
|---|---|
|Common|Low power; simple or utility effects|
|Uncommon|Enhanced utility or small combat edges|
|Rare|Strong power; often requires attunement|
|Very Rare|Major power; risks/limits common|
|Legendary|Unique artifacts tied to myth/gods|
|Mythic|Near-divine, reality-bending, often sentient|

**Attuning.** Attune (1 min; 5 Vitality to un-attune). Max **3** attuned items per character unless an item (or your class) says otherwise.

==============================
FILE: Chapter 7 - Equipment and Items (WIP)/7.3 Crafting and Enchanting (WIP).md
==============================

Crafting produces physical items (weapons, armor, tools, wondrous frames). Enchanting adds or moves magical effects (runes, infusions). Both systems use the same core ideas:
- **Blueprint** (what you‚Äôre making or copying)
- **Materials** (the frame & additives that set stats and enchantability)
- **Tools & Workspace** (kits/benches that change DC/time)
- **Check Cycle** (rolls that build **Progress** toward a **Target**)
- **Quality** (outcome band: Flawed ‚Üí Standard ‚Üí Fine ‚Üí Masterwork ‚Üí Exquisite ‚Üí Mythic)
- **Mishaps** (only on big failures, with explicit consequences)

> Ability & skill: When a step says **Craft(Tools, Ability)**, use the tool proficiency and the listed ability:  
> ‚Ä¢ Smithing Tools ‚Üí **Craft(STR)**  
> ‚Ä¢ Tinker‚Äôs Tools ‚Üí **Craft(DEX)**  
> ‚Ä¢ Alchemist Kit (for permanent infusions) ‚Üí **Craft(INT)**  
> ‚Ä¢ Enchanter‚Äôs Kit (engraving runes) ‚Üí **Arcana(INT)**  
> ‚Ä¢ Scribing Tools (scrolls) ‚Üí **Arcana(INT)**  
> If you have a class/feat feature that improves ‚Äúcrafting‚Äù or ‚Äúengraving,‚Äù add it as normal.
### Tools & Kits (material variants)

These set **engraving DC**, weight, and add riders. (Use the best piece in the set for the bonus.)

| Tool / Kit                  | Best Materials                            | Engrave DC | Weight Notes | Material Rider                                                                                                                  |
| --------------------------- | ----------------------------------------- | ---------: | -----------: | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Smithing Tools**          | Steel, **Nerite** (anvil), **Canyonstar** |      10‚Äì18 |     √ó1.0‚Äì1.2 | **Nerite anvil:** +2 to Sunder/Repair checks. **Canyonstar hearth plate:** ‚àí2 to Craft Mishap DC (safer).                       |
| **Alchemist Kit (vessels)** | **Voidglass**, Phoenixscale alloy, Nerite |   **9‚Äì12** |     √ó0.3‚Äì1.0 | **Voidglass** vessels are **shatterproof vs magic**; **Phoenixscale** vials grant Fire-safe handling (no self-ignite on fails). |
| **Enchanter‚Äôs Kit**         | **Ferroflux** frame, Canyonstar plate     |   **8‚Äì10** |    √ó1.2/0.95 | **Ferroflux frame:** **‚àí2 DC** to any engraving you perform; **Canyonstar backer:** -1 DC to hold the lattice clean.            |
| **Thieves‚Äô Tools**          | Steel, Runewood handles                   |      12‚Äì15 |    √ó0.7‚Äì0.95 | Runewood silent grips (advantage vs noise checks).                                                                              |
| **Herbalist Kit**           | Bronze, Runewood                          |      12‚Äì14 |     √ó0.6‚Äì1.1 | Bronze safe with acids; Runewood light.                                                                                         |
| **Tinker‚Äôs Tools**          | Canyonstar, **Ferroflux**                 |   **8‚Äì10** |     √ó0.9‚Äì1.2 | **Ferroflux sockets** accept +1 embedded rune for **gadgets** only.                                                             |
| **Scribing Tools**          | Gold nib / Platinum feed                  |     **10** |            - | -1 DC to scroll scribing (smoother flow).                                                                                       |
| **Mason / Glassblower**     | Obsidian, Canyonstar, **Voidglass**       |       9‚Äì12 |            - | **Voidglass** crucibles ignore thermal shock/backflow.                                                                          |
| Inscription Kit             |                                           |         10 |            - |                                                                                                                                 |

> **Engrave DC** above is your **tool baseline** for Arcana (engraving) checks before material/complexity modifiers.

### Materials Reference (frames & stats)

Weapons/armor/tool **frames** take their base stats from the item tables. **Material** modifies weight, durability, AC/damage step, and **Engrave DC** (how hard it is to implant runes). Lower DC is _easier_ to engrave.

**Key terms**
- **Weight √ó**: multiply listed weight.
- **Durability**: Sunder Threshold (ST) is the DC to break the item with a Sunder attempt; **Item HP** is how much structural HP it has if you track it.
- **Material Quality Bonus (MQB)**: a universal small bump applied to **weapon damage** and **armor AC** (see each row). MQB is deliberately conservative; most power comes from runes.
- **Engrave Mod**: add to your **final** Engrave DC (negative is good).
- **Rune Cap**: maximum rune slots the frame can safely carry **before** overload penalties (you can exceed with risk).
- **Special**: always-on rider of the material.

| Material           |     Tier | Weight √ó | Durability (ST / Item HP√ó) |      MQB (Weapons / Armor) | Engrave Mod | Rune Cap | Special                                                                                |
| ------------------ | -------: | -------: | -------------------------: | -------------------------: | ----------: | -------: | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Copper**         |      Low |      0.9 |                  10 / √ó0.6 |        ‚àí1 dmg step / ‚àí1 AC |          ‚àí0 |        1 | Soft; +1 to smith speed; corrodes (repair every 2 weeks in damp).                      |
| **Bronze**         |      Low |      1.0 |                  12 / √ó0.8 |        ‚àí1 dmg step / ‚àí1 AC |          ‚àí0 |        1 | Acid-safe prep; +1 to Craft checks vs organic parts.                                   |
| **Iron**           |     Base |      1.1 |                  14 / √ó1.0 |                   baseline |          +1 |        1 | Magnetic; ‚àí1 to ranged stealth (clank).                                                |
| **Steel**          | Standard |      1.0 |                  16 / √ó1.2 |            **+0** / **+0** |          +0 |        2 | Baseline you used everywhere.                                                          |
| **Ferroflux**      |      Odd |      1.0 |                  12 / √ó0.9 |        ‚àí1 dmg step / ‚àí1 AC |      **‚àí4** |        5 | _Worst combat metal, best enchantability._                                             |
| **Silvered**       |    Spec. |      1.0 |                  13 / √ó0.9 |                  0 / ‚àí1 AC |          +1 |        2 | Counts as silver vs lycan/undead; on nat 1: hairline crack (repair).                   |
| **Gold**           |    Spec. |      1.4 |                  10 / √ó0.7 |            ‚àí1 step / ‚àí1 AC |          ‚àí1 |        2 | Poor in combat; great for foci; +1 to Rituals.                                         |
| **Platinum**       |    Spec. |      1.2 |                  14 / √ó1.0 |                      0 / 0 |          ‚àí1 |        2 | Stable matrix for scrolls & foci.                                                      |
| **Runewood**       |    Light |      0.6 |                  12 / √ó0.8 | bows +1 range band / ‚àí1 AC |          ‚àí1 |        3 | Living grain: advantage to engrave _Nature/Balance_ runes.                             |
| **Obsidian**       |    Glass |      0.8 |                   8 / √ó0.6 |      +1 crit range / ‚àí2 AC |          ‚àí2 |        2 | Brittle: on attack roll 1‚Äì2, DC 12 to avoid chipping (‚àí1 dmg until repaired).          |
| **Echostone**      |      Mid |      1.1 |                  18 / √ó1.3 |                  0 / +1 AC |          ‚àí1 |        3 | Resonant: once/encounter echo a triggered **Armor** rune at half effect (free).        |
| **Canyonstar**     |      Mid |      1.0 |                  18 / √ó1.3 |                  0 / +1 AC |      **‚àí2** |        4 | ‚ÄúClean lattice‚Äù: +1 success margin on engraving; best **enchantability** mid-tier.     |
| **Voidsand Alloy** |     High |     0.95 |                  20 / √ó1.4 |             +1 dmg / +1 AC |          +1 |        4 | Spell-damping: attackers‚Äô spell attack vs you **‚àí1**; your Anti-Magic runes get +1 DC. |
| **Phoenixscale**   |     High |      1.0 |                  18 / √ó1.2 |                  0 / +1 AC |          ‚àí1 |        3 | **Fire Resist** (armor); weapons add **+1d4 Fire (1/turn)**.                           |
| **Moltenheart**    |     High |      1.1 |                  18 / √ó1.2 |                 +1 dmg / 0 |          ‚àí1 |        3 | **Ignite** on weapon crit (1d6 Fire, 2 rounds, CON 14 ends).                           |
| **Nerite Alloy**   |      Top |     1.05 |              **22 / √ó1.6** |         **+1 dmg / +2 AC** |      **+3** |        4 | **Unsu nderable** by non-Mythic; +1 Max Rune **Tier** (see Enchanting).                |
| **Voidglass**      |    Spec. |      0.3 |                   8 / √ó0.4 |                          ‚Äî |          ‚àí3 |        2 | Vessel only: shatterproof vs magic; not for weapons/armor.                             |

**Damage Step**: stepping **down** turns 1d8 ‚Üí 1d6, 1d10 ‚Üí 1d8, 2d6 ‚Üí 1d10, etc. Stepping **up** reverses it. Don‚Äôt step below 1d4 or above 1d12/2d6 without magic.
### Crafting: from blank to finished

**You need**: the **Blueprint**, correct **Materials**, a **Workspace**, the **Tools**, and time.
#### A) Determine DC and Target
1. **Pick Rarity Tier (frame)**  
    Use the base table (your earlier note). We‚Äôll keep those and add complexity modifiers.

|Rarity|Base Craft DC|Base Work Units (WU) Target|
|---|--:|--:|
|Common|10|8 WU|
|Uncommon|15|16 WU|
|Rare|25|32 WU|
|Very Rare|30|64 WU|
|Legendary|45+|128 WU (or quest-gated)|
2. **Add Modifiers** (sum them onto the DC)
- **Material**: use **Material Engrave Mod** only for Enchanting; for **Craft DC**, use:  
    Copper ‚àí1, Bronze 0, Iron +1, Steel 0, Ferroflux +2 (it warps), Silver +1, Gold +2, Platinum +1, Runewood ‚àí1, Obsidian +1, **Echostone 0**, **Canyonstar ‚àí1**, **Voidsand +2**, **Phoenixscale 0**, **Moltenheart 0**, **Nerite +3**.
- **Size/Complexity**:  
    Light weapon/Small tool **+0**; One-handed weapon/Medium tool **+1**; Two-handed or Heavy armor **+3**; Shield/Medium armor **+2**.  
    Add **+1** per special property beyond default (e.g., Scythe ‚ÄúFinesse Two-Handed‚Äù counts as 1).
- **Workspace**: Field kit **+2 DC**; Proper shop **0**; Master forge/bench **‚àí2 DC**.
- **Assistants**: One proficient helper grants **advantage** or **‚àí2 DC** (choose one). Max 2 helpers.

**Example Craft DC** = Base (Rare 25) + Material (Canyonstar ‚àí1) + Size (Shield +2) + Workspace (Shop 0) = **DC 26**.

3. **Set the Work Unit (WU) Target**  
    Use base by rarity (table above). Professionals can split work over any number of days.
#### B) Work Cycle & Progress
- Each **Work Cycle** is **4 hours** of focused work. At the end, roll **Craft(Tools, Ability)** vs the **Craft DC**.
- On a **success**, you generate **Progress** = (check result ‚àí DC) **+ your proficiency bonus** (minimum **1 WU**).  
    On a **natural 20**, double the Progress from that cycle.  
    On a **fail by 1‚Äì4**, **0 WU** and gain **1 Fatigue point** (three Fatigue = Disadvantage on next cycle only).  
    On a **fail by 5+**, roll on the **Craft Mishap d12** (below), then **0 WU**.
- When your accumulated **Progress ‚â• Target WU**, the frame is complete. Proceed to **Finishing** (polish, fit, quench)‚Äîtakes **1 extra hour** (no roll).
#### C) Quality Band
Compare your **final cycle‚Äôs** margin of success and total success count:

| Quality                                                                           | Benefits                                                                                                                                |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| **Flawed** (finished but you incurred ‚â•2 Mishaps, or final roll only just met DC) | ‚àí1 to item‚Äôs MQB effect (min 0). First Sunder check vs it gains +2.                                                                     |
| **Standard** (met DC with <2 Mishaps)                                             | As listed.                                                                                                                              |
| **Fine** (any cycle beat DC by **10+** at least once)                             | +1 **Durability ST**, +10% weight reduction (round to 0.1 lb).                                                                          |
| **Masterwork** (beat DC by **15+** once, or two cycles by **10+**)                | +1 to hit (weapons) **or** +1 AC (armor) **before magic**; +1 **Rune Cap** for **this frame only**.                                     |
| **Exquisite** (nat 20 **and** beat DC by **15+** in same cycle)                   | As Masterwork **and** choose: reduce future **Engrave DC** on this item by **2**, **or** add **+1 WU die** to any future upgrade on it. |
| **Mythic** (GM award; quest chain)                                                | Unique naming, story boons; treat as **Very Rare** chassis for enchanting caps even if the frame started lower.                         |

> **Rework:** You can re-temper a Flawed item: 1 cycle, DC ‚àí2; success upgrades to **Standard** (no other gains).

#### D) Craft Mishap (d12)

1 **Warped temper**: reduce Durability ST by 2 (can be re-tempered with 1 iron ingot, 1 cycle).  
2 **Hairline crack**: first crit against it forces Repair after combat.  
3 **Tool slip**: you take 1d6 damage; lose 1 hour (no roll).  
4 **Bad quench**: weapons ‚àí1 damage until re-quench (1 cycle); armor ‚àí1 AC until re-fit.  
5 **Material impurity**: +1 Engrave DC on this item only.  
6 **Loose fitting**: disadvantage on first Sunder check against it each day.  
7 **Surface pitting**: ‚àí1 to Persuasion/Value checks to sell (it looks rough).  
8 **Balance off**: ‚àí1 to hit (weapons) until you spend 1 cycle to rebalance.  
9 **Rivet pop / seam tear**: ‚àí1 Item HP√ó (down one step) until repaired.  
10 **Workspace scorch**: no helper bonuses next cycle.  
11 **Shattered insert**: lose 10% of your rare material by weight.  
12 **Minor explosion**: you and a helper take 1d6 Fire/Force; items safe.

### Upgrading, Repair & Sunder

**Repair** (same crafter or any smith)
- **Minor (cosmetic/edge)**: 1 hour, DC = original DC ‚àí5.
- **Functional** (lost MQB, hit penalty, seam): 1 cycle, DC = original DC ‚àí2.
- **Structural** (crack, broken guard): 2 cycles, DC = original.
- **Shattered**: 50% materials required; treat as **new** craft with **WU Target halved**.

**Sunder (combat)**  
To break: attacker declares a **Sunder** (uses an attack). On hit, roll opposed check vs **Durability ST**. On success:
- **Weapons**: **Dulled** (‚àí1 dmg) ‚Üí **Cracked** (‚àí2 to hit) ‚Üí **Broken** (unusable).
- **Armor/Shields**: **Dented** (‚àí1 AC) ‚Üí **Breached** (‚àí2 AC) ‚Üí **Broken** (no AC).  
    Repairs follow the tiers above. **Nerite** ignores non-Mythic Sunder effects.

**Material swap / Reforging**  
To upgrade a Steel piece to Nerite (for example), craft a **new frame** (same blueprint) and spend **1 extra cycle** to **transplant** fittings and any runes (engraving checks still required). If you have a **Runebinder‚Äôs Needle**, you can move runes safely 1/day.
###  Enchanting (Runes, Infusions, )

### A) Rune Slots & Caps
- **Base Rune Slots by item** (before material):  
    Weapons **1**; Shields **1**; Light Armor **1**; Medium **2**; Heavy **2**; Wondrous **1**; Staves **2**.
- **Material Rune Cap** modifies the **maximum safe** total (see Materials table). Exceeding the cap causes **Overload** (below).
- **Masterwork/Exquisite** crafting can add **+1 slot** (frame-only).
#### B) Engraving DC (exact math)
When adding or moving a rune, roll **Arcana(INT)** using your Enchanter‚Äôs Kit.
**Engrave DC = 10 + 3√ó(Total runes after this one) + Item Magic Step + Material Engrave Mod + Workspace Mod + Complexity Mod**
- **Item Magic Step:** Common 0, Uncommon **+2**, Rare **+4**, Very Rare **+6**, Legendary **+8**.
- **Material Engrave Mod:** from Materials table (e.g., Ferroflux **‚àí4**, Nerite **+3**, Canyonstar **‚àí2**, Voidsand **+1**, Steel **0**).
- **Workspace:** Field **+2**, Bench **0**, Master Enchantry **‚àí2**.
- **Complexity Mod:** Rune **Tier 1/2/3/4/5** adds **+0/+2/+4/+6/+8**. Nerite allows **+1 Max Rune Tier** on that item.
- **Tool perks:** Ferroflux **Kit Frame ‚àí2**, Canyonstar plate **‚àí1**, Runesmith‚Äôs Chisel: advantage or ‚àí2.

**Success:** rune sits, immediate effect.  
**Fail by 1‚Äì4:** no slot consumed; you may try again after 1 hour.  
**Fail by 5+ (Surge):** roll **Enchant Mishap d12** (below). The attempt consumes 50% of the rune‚Äôs catalyst value.

**Time:** Each engraving attempt takes **1 hour** per rune tier (T1=1h, T3=3h, etc.).
#### C) Overload & Stabilizers

Going **over the item‚Äôs Rune Cap** adds **+4 DC per extra rune** and risks **Overload** each long rest: roll Arcana DC **15 + 2√ó(excess runes)**. On fail, one random rune **goes dormant** for 24h and the item takes **Stress** (‚àí1 to Engrave attempts on it) until repaired (1 hour, DC 12).

**Stabilizers** (consumed on use):
- **Eclipticorb:** negate **one** Mishap roll **or** remove **two** Stress stacks from the item.
- **Canyonstar powder (trace)**: **‚àí1 Engrave DC** for this attempt (stacks once).
- **Ferroflux paste:** allows **moving** a socketed rune to a new slot on the **same item** without re-rolling (once per item/day).
#### D) Enchant Mishap (d12)

1 **Backfeed**: you take 2d6 Force; rune fails.  
2 **Scorch lines**: +2 Engrave DC on this item for 24h.  
3 **Polarity flip**: rune inverts for 1 hour (e.g., Fire ‚Üí Cold).  
4 **Dormant**: all runes on this item disable for 10 minutes.  
5 **Hairline lattice**: ‚àí1 Rune Cap until repaired (1h DC 14).  
6 **Wild spark**: trigger a random **Tier-1** rune effect in 10 ft (GM pick from your lists).  
7 **Anchoring slip**: rune sits but at **‚àí1** to its DC/attack until re-set (1h DC original ‚àí2).  
8 **Overheat**: you gain **1 Exhaustion** unless CON 14.  
9 **Bleedthrough**: nearby ally takes 1d6 of the rune‚Äôs damage type (if any).  
10 **Static lock**: you cannot attempt engraving for 1 hour.  
11 **Rune drift**: rune shifts slot; if no free slot, it pops out (salvage 50%).  
12 **Minor fizzle**: nothing happens; you may immediately retry at **+2 DC** or stop.
#### E) Direct Infusions (permanent passives)
Instead of a standard rune, you can stitch a **Catalyst** into the frame (e.g., Phoenixscale, Moltenheart, Voidsand). Use **Craft(INT)** with **Alchemist Kit** **or** **Arcana** with Enchanter‚Äôs Kit (your choice).
- **Infusion DC** = 12 + Material Engrave Mod + Item Magic Step
- **Time** = 2 hours (Phoenixscale/Moltenheart), 3 hours (Voidsand), 4 hours (Nerite channel), unless the catalyst says otherwise.
- **Effect examples**:  
    ‚Ä¢ **Phoenixscale:** Fire Resistance (armor) or +1d4 Fire (weapons, 1/turn).  
    ‚Ä¢ **Moltenheart:** Ignite on crit (weapons) or +1 Fire AC (armor).  
    ‚Ä¢ **Voidsand:** ‚àí1 to incoming spell attack rolls vs wearer; enables **Anti-Magic** rune without extra DC.  
    ‚Ä¢ **Nerite Dust (bound):** +1 Max Rune **Tier** on this item (stacks once).  
    ‚Ä¢ **Echostone shard (bedded):** armor echoes a **triggered** rune once/encounter at half effect.

Fail by 5+: roll **Enchant Mishap**.
#### F) Disenchanting & Salvage
- **Pop a Rune**: **Runebinder‚Äôs Needle** (1/day, no roll) or Arcana DC **15 + Rune Tier**; success salvages the rune intact; fail by 5+ loses it (50% catalyst back).
- **Grind to Dust**: spend 1 hour; regain **50‚Äì75%** of the catalyst value; frame unaffected.
- **Strip a Frame**: to reuse a Nerite/Voidsand frame, spend 2 hours, DC 15; success clears Stress and residual enchantment trace.
#### Time, Costs, and Materials
**Material Units (MU)**: abstracted weight/volume of the main metal/medium.

|Frame|MU|
|---|--:|
|Light weapon / small tool|2 MU|
|One-handed weapon / shield / medium tool|4 MU|
|Two-handed weapon / large tool|8 MU|
|Light armor suit|6 MU|
|Medium armor suit|10 MU|
|Heavy armor suit|14 MU|

- **Rarity surcharge** (if the blueprint itself is rarer than mundane): Uncommon +25% MU, Rare +50%, Very Rare +75%, Legendary custom/quest.
- **Costs**: If you track coin, price each MU of material by scarcity (Copper 1, Bronze 2, Iron 3, Steel 5, Silver 15, Gold 50, Runewood 6, Obsidian 4, Echostone 20, Canyonstar 25, Voidsand 60, Phoenixscale 80, Moltenheart 80, Nerite 120). Kits/benches are separate.

**Assist & Pace**
- You can work **2 cycles** (8h) safely per day. A third cycle inflicts **1 Exhaustion**.
- 1‚Äì2 trained helpers cap at the bonuses stated earlier (advantage or ‚àí2 DC each; pick).
### Examples (complete, step-by-step)

### EX1) Canyonstar **Shield** (Rare frame) ‚Üí Rune of Protection (T2)
- **Blueprint**: Shield (base stats from 7.1).
- **Material**: Canyonstar (Engrave ‚àí2; Craft DC ‚àí1; Rune Cap +4).
- **Rarity**: Rare (better fittings, improved straps).
- **Craft DC**: Base 25 + Material (‚àí1) + Size (Shield +2) + Workspace (Shop 0) = **26**.
- **WU Target**: 32.
- **Work**: You roll 29, 26, 31 over three cycles with proficiency +4. Progress = (3 + 4) + (0 + 4) + (5 + 4) = **20 WU**. You need **12** more; fourth cycle you roll 28 ‚Üí (2 + 4) = 6; fifth cycle 33 ‚Üí (7 + 4) = 11 ‚Üí **37 WU total** (done).
- **Quality**: one roll beat DC by 7, one by 5; **Fine** ‚áí +1 ST and ‚àí10% weight.
- **Engrave**: Add **Protection (T2)**. **Engrave DC = 10 + 3√ó(1) + Item Step + Material (‚àí2) + Workspace 0 + Tier +2** = 10 + 3 + 4 ‚àí 2 + 0 + 2 = **17**. You roll Arcana 20 ‚áí success.
- **Result**: Shield with +1 AC from **Fine**, **Rune: Protection** as written in your Affinity list, ST baseline +1, weight ‚àí10%.
### EX2) **Nerite Full Plate** (Very Rare) with **Anti-Magic (T3)** and **Voidsand** infusion
- **Craft DC**: Base 30 + Material **Nerite +3** + Size Heavy +3 + Workspace Master Forge ‚àí2 = **34**.
- **WU Target**: 64. (Expect 8‚Äì10 cycles; you planned a week.)
- If you achieve **Masterwork**, you‚Äôll also get +1 AC and +1 Rune Cap.
- **Engrave #1 (Anti-Magic, T3)**: Engrave DC = 10 + 3√ó(1) + Item Step (Very Rare +6) + Material **+3** + Workspace ‚àí2 + Tier **+4** = **24**.
- **Engrave #2 (Voidsand infusion)**: DC = 12 + Material +3 + Step +6 = **21** (Craft(INT) or Arcana).
- **Overload**: Nerite Cap 4; Heavy base 2; Masterwork +1 ‚Üí safe up to **5 runes**; you only used 2‚Äîno Overload.
### EX3) **Steel Longsword** ‚Üí Upgrade to **Voidsand Alloy** and move the **Fire rune**
1. Craft a new Voidsand frame (Uncommon fit): Base 15 + Material +2 + Size +1 = **18**, target 16 WU.
2. **Transplant** (1 extra cycle, DC 15) to move guard/pommel/grip onto the new frame.
3. **Move rune** with **Runebinder‚Äôs Needle** (1/day): no roll. Otherwise Arcana vs DC from the Engrave formula.
### Optional: Batch Crafting & Ammo
- **Batch** (arrows, bolts, darts): treat 20 pieces as **1 frame** at Uncommon DC; on finish, roll Quality once for the batch.
### Quick Reference
- **Craft DC** = Base by rarity ¬± Material (craft) ¬± Size/Props ¬± Workspace (¬±2) (helpers: advantage or ‚àí2).
- **WU Target** = 8/16/32/64/128 (Common‚ÜíLegendary).
- **Progress per cycle** = (roll ‚àí DC) + proficiency (min 1). Nat 20 = double progress.
- **Engrave DC** = **10 + 3√órunes total + Item Step (0/2/4/6/8) + Material Engrave Mod + Workspace (¬±2) + Tier (0/2/4/6/8)**.
- **Overload** = +4 DC per extra rune; nightly Overload check DC 15 + 2√óexcess; on fail: 1 rune dormant + Stress.
- **Stabilizers**: **Eclipticorb** cancels one Mishap / removes 2 Stress; **Canyonstar dust** ‚àí1 DC; **Ferroflux paste** moves a rune in-item once/day.

### Currency & Exchange
- **100 Copper (C) = 1 Silver (S)**
- **100 Silver (S) = 1 Gold (G)**
- **100 Gold (G) = 1 Platinum (P)**
- **100 Platinum (P) = 1 Nerite (N)**

- **Coin weight:** 100 coins ‚âà 1 lb.
- **Bank notes/letters of credit:** 1% fee (city), 3% (frontier).
- **Gemstones:** trade at face value (appraise DC 12‚Äì18); easy way to move wealth.
- **Regional price modifiers** (apply once, GM chooses strongest):  
    Village √ó1.1 (low stock), Town √ó1.0, City √ó0.95, Capital √ó0.9, War-torn √ó1.25, Famine √ó1.5, Boomtown √ó1.2.
### Bartering & Negotiation 
**Starting price** = listed price (or formula below). Then apply _one_ haggling step per side.
- **Haggle check:** contested **Persuasion** (buyers) vs **Insight** (sellers).  
    Alternatives: **Deception** vs **Insight** (if lying), **Intimidation** vs **Wisdom save** (if coercive).
- **Outcome (pick the best one success per side):**  
    ‚Ä¢ Win by **1‚Äì4**: ¬±5% price.  
    ‚Ä¢ Win by **5‚Äì9**: ¬±10%.  
    ‚Ä¢ Win by **10‚Äì14**: ¬±20%.  
    ‚Ä¢ Win by **15+**: ¬±30% (cap).  
    ‚Ä¢ Natural 20: instead of above, you may add a free small add-on (ammo bundle, sheath, 1√ó vial) worth ‚â§5% of item price.  
    ‚Ä¢ Natural 1: opposite side chooses the ¬±5% result.
- **Advantage/disadvantage**: give advantage for good leverage (bulk sale ‚â•10 units, trusted guild badge, proven need, local scarcity), disadvantage for poor leverage (hostile town, crime heat, damaged goods).
- **Black market**: +10‚Äì50% price; illegal goods carry a **Seizure risk** (DC 14 stealth/social check per transaction; on fail, fine = 50% of item value; repeat offenders risk confiscation/jail as the story demands).
### Selling Loot & Condition
- **Vendor base buy (like-new)**: **50%** of listed price (unless high demand ‚Üí up to **80%**).
- **Used/Damaged condition** (apply **instead** of the 50% rule; take the lower result if both could apply):  
    ‚Ä¢ **Lightly used (clean, no defects):** pays **10‚Äì20%** of base.  
    ‚Ä¢ **Used (visible wear):** **5‚Äì14%**.  
    ‚Ä¢ **Mostly unusable (parts only):** **1‚Äì4%**.  
    ‚Ä¢ **Scrap** (bent/ruined): **0.5‚Äì1%** (material salvage only).
- **High demand**: seller may treat an item as one condition tier better **or** raise the buy rate to as high as **80%** (GM sets scarcity).
- **Appraise (INT)**: DC 12 for common, 15 uncommon, 18 rare+ to know fair value within ¬±10%.
### Using the Economy at the Table
- **Resource management:** supplies, repairs, and consumables matter (see exact mechanics per item below).
- **Downtime:** run a shop (Profits below), craft/enchant (see ¬ß7.4), or trade routes.

**Shop Profits (simple):** Spend 1 week. Roll **Business (CHA)** (Proficiency if you own a stall/permit).  
Result ‚Äì 10 = **profit weeks** √ó **10%** of your shop‚Äôs weekly overhead (round up), cap **+50%** of overhead. Nat 1 = ‚àí25% losses; Nat 20 = +100% bonus week. (GM may swap overhead for ‚Äúinventory value on hand.‚Äù)

### F) Magic Items (market guidance)
**Magic markets** price by **rarity + attunement + risk**. Use this matrix unless an item is plot-bound.

|Rarity|Typical Price|Coin|Notes|
|---|--:|:-:|---|
|Common|50‚Äì200|G|Utility trinkets; no attunement.|
|Uncommon|200‚Äì1,000|G|Light combat perks.|
|Rare|1‚Äì5|**P**|Attunement; class synergies.|
|Very Rare|5‚Äì20|**P**|Strong; risks/requirements.|
|Legendary|20‚Äì100|**P**|Unique; quest-locked usually.|
|Mythic|1‚Äì10|**N**|Artifact tier; mostly not for sale.|

### I) Taxes, Tariffs & Permits (optional realism)
- **City import duty:** 1‚Äì3% on goods >100 G.
- **Alchemy permit:** 5 G/month (common), 50 G/month (volatile class), **500 G/month** (cataclysmic) + inspection.
- **Rune shop license:** 50 G/year; reduces liability fines by half.
- **Explosives transport tag:** 1 G/trip within city, 5 G gate pass.
### J) Worked Examples (buying/selling)

**Selling a used Scale Mail (steel), visibly worn:** base 100 G. Condition table says **5‚Äì14%** ‚Üí vendor offers 8 G after a weak haggle. In a war zone (high demand), GM bumps to **20%** (20 G). If it were like-new, base vendor rule would be 50 G.

**Commission: Canyonstar longsword with T2 Protection rune.**  
Frame: MU 4 √ó 25 G = **100 G**; Labor Uncommon +2√óMU= **+8 G** ‚Üí **108 G**. Rune stone T2 ~ **100 G**, Engraving labor **40 G**, Workshop fee **20 G**; Safety Eclipticorb **200 G** (optional).  
**Total:** 268 G (or 468 G with safety). Haggling can move this ¬±5‚Äì20%.


==============================
FILE: Chapter 8 - Monsters/8 Monsters.md
==============================

Note: Players generally don‚Äôt need to read this section, these stat blocks are used by the GM. If you're curious about how monsters are built or want to design your own later, you can revisit this part. If you want a general understanding just read through 8.1 and 8.2.1-8.2.2.

Monsters in The World of Eyum are the creatures, entities, and horrors that populate the world. They range from wild animals and corrupted abominations to celestial beings and eldritch horrors. Monsters serve as adversaries, obstacles, and even potential allies, depending on the context of an encounter.

Monsters in Eyum follow the same core mechanics as player characters but are built differently, using simplified stat blocks for ease of play. Their attributes, abilities, and behavior depend on their lore, classification, and purpose within an encounter.

Below is a list of all monsters currently in the TTRPG; This is very much a WIP and likely missing half of the monsters.
